body:
_visiting for triage_

`rustc 1.0.0-nightly (ba2f13ef0 2015-02-04 20:03:55 +0000)`

This is still valid, I get an ICE when compiling:

```
error: internal compiler error: translating unsupported cast: f64 (cast_float) -> *const libc::types::common::c95::FILE (cast_pointer)
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', /Users/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/nightly-dist-rustc-mac/build/src/libsyntax/diagnostic.rs:189
```

_Still broken_

[Here](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/src/test/compile-fail/unsupported-cast.rs) is the relevant code easy reference:

``` rust
#![feature(libc)]
extern crate libc;

fn main() {
  println!("{:?}", 1.0 as *const libc::FILE); // Can't cast float to foreign.
}
```

```
$ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 rustc gh13993.rs

gh13993.rs:5   println!("{:?}", 1.0 as *const libc::FILE); // Can't cast float to foreign.
                                ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```
